thread.title: Manchester United's Anthony Martial taking a back seat again after not doing enough to win Jose Mourinho over
thread.title_full: Manchester United's Anthony Martial taking a back seat again after not doing enough to win Jose Mourinho over

author: David McDonnell
title: Manchester United's Anthony Martial taking a back seat again after not doing enough to win Jose Mourinho over
text:
Sport Manchester United's Anthony Martial taking a back seat again after not doing enough to win Jose Mourinho over The Frenchman made two goals in the FA Cup win over Wigan but is set to lose out to Henrikh Mkhitaryan against Hull Share Martial is looking increasingly likely to leave Mourinho's United in the summer (Photo: Getty Images/Cavendish Press) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Anthony Martial has failed in his latest bid to convince Jose Mourinho he deserves a regular starting place for Manchester United . 
Forward Martial started Sunday's FA Cup win over Wigan on Sunday and, after being warned by boss Mourinho that he was on trial, set up two goals in the 4-0 victory. 
But the 21-year-old’s contribution was not enough to sway Mourinho, with the United boss confirming the France forward will be back on the bench for Wednesday night’s visit of relegation candidates Hull. 
His latest demotion this season raises serious questions about Martial's United future, with summer 2014's surprise £36million signing from Monaco having fallen short of Mourinho’s expectations. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now IN FULL: Jose Mourinho speaks after FA Cup win Share this video Watch Next 
The final fee for Martial could ultimately rise to £58m — United are required to cough up another £10m once he nets another two goals, taking his tally from them to 25 — but it seems increasingly likely he could be offloaded this summer, with Mourinho growing tired of the youngster's failure to take the chances he is given. 
Asked if Martial had done enough to warrant a starting-place against Hull, the manager said: “Enough to be on the bench. 
“He has to perform better than the others who are competing for the same positions. His position is one where we have lots of options. Do you want me to leave Henrikh Mkhitaryan out after being Man of the Match and playing so well? I can’t. 
“The players pick themselves. I am just there to analyse what they do and try to be fair with them. Such a good performance, Mkhitaryan has to play tomorrow. 
"Simple.” Martial did well but not well enough against Wigan on Sunday... (Photo: Reuters) ...as Mkhitaryan got Man of the Match and HAS to start vs Hull, says Mourinho (Photo: PA Wire) Read More Mourinho reveals passion for more titles and makes Special One joke in new car ad 
United began this midweek round of fixtures in sixth spot, four points off fourth-place Liverpool. 
Mourinho is desperate to secure a top-four finish in his debut season and make an immediate return to European football's top table. 
“Personally, I miss Champions League,” he said. 
“Every match I don’t play in the Champions League means an incredible number of matches is not going up. I’m the youngest coach to be in the club of 100 [Champions League games]. Every time I don’t play, I’m not happy. 
“But obviously Manchester United is much more important than me and my individual targets. What matters is United and, as everyone knows, United is a club that belongs to the Champions League. Twice winner Mourinho wants United to be a Champions League side next season (Photo: Getty) Read More Lingard admits United's players are still trying to impress new boss Mourinho 
“We shall do everything possible to make sure we’re in the Champions League next season. We have two chances to be there. One is by winning the Europa League, the other is by finishing in the top four. Both achievable, both difficult, but we’re going to work hard for that.” 
Mourinho also took a swipe at Liverpool counterpart Jurgen Klopp and other Premier League coaches who fielded weakened sides in the FA Cup and got dumped out of the competition. 
Klopp made nine changes and watched his Reds lose 2-1 at home to Championship Wolves, while Southampton boss Claude Puel switched 10 players and took a 5-0 thumping by Arsenal. 
“I don’t do that, even if I am the manager of a club without the same ambitions as us - especially in the FA Cup," said the Special One. Mourinho says we won't see him make as many FA Cup changes as Klopp did (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Read More Mourinho plays down Bailly concerns after defender limps out of United U23s game 
“I did it once, in my first year in England. I understood the mistake. I understood the dimensions of my decision. 
"It was a period where we had to play Barcelona in the Champions League. We went direct to the League Cup final against Liverpool. In that period we played Newcastle in the FA Cup and I threw it away. 
"I understood the dimension. The FA Cup deserves respect, so I don’t do that. If I’m changing players, I do it because I have to give chances to some other players. I have to give a rest to some others. 
“I will change players against Blackburn [in the fifth round next month] because I have to give players a chance. I will change, but I’m not going with a team with seven kids. I can’t do that. I will risk, but I can’t do that.” poll loading Where will Manchester United finish this season? 5000+ VOTES SO FAR
